poem:
In Memory of Echoes

A resolution passed   
like autumn leaves,  
honor wrapped in silence,  
patriotism whispers   
through the Capitol halls—  
Charlie,  
beneath marble and grief,  
a shadow cast  
against flickering screens,  
as voices converge  
in a fragile unity,  
paper rasping  
beneath the weight  
of absent breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US House passes resolution to honor Charlie Kirk as ‘courageous patriot’ The killing of the conservative activist Charlie Kirk last week has triggered a wave of political disquiet in Washington, with some House Democrats fearing a messaging trap over a Republican resolution to honor him while other lawmakers worry about the broader political temperature following government pressure on broadcasters. Democrats ultimately decided to side with the Republicans to pass the resolution, with 95 Democrats in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: US House passes resolution to honor Charlie Kirk as ‘courageous patriot’ The killing of the conservative activist Charlie Kirk last week has triggered a wave of political disquiet in Washington, with some House Democrats fearing a messaging trap over a Republican resolution to honor him while other lawmakers worry about the broader political temperature following government pressure on broadcasters.
